node.title: Climber dies, another critically hurt after falling 200 feet on Mount Hood
node.description: Rescue crews encountered deep snow and avalanche conditions, with winds blowing between 50 and 70 mph, officials said.

node.title: Arizona hiker rescued twice in as many days from mountain trails
node.description: After the second time, sheriff's officials said he was "was "provided with preventative search and rescue education" material.

node.title: U.N. says war in Ukraine has created more than 2 million new refugees
node.description: Thousands are still desperate to flee, but others are digging in to fight as Ukraine says Russia is already violating a new cease-fire for humanitarian evacuations.

node.title: How Kyiv's community is rallying in a time of war: "We're standing"
node.description: By night, Viktor Vemuna is in a bomb shelter with his family. During the day, he's doing everything he can to help his fellow Ukrainians survive.

node.title: Shell says it will stop buying Russian oil and natural gas
node.description: Energy giant will also close all of its service stations in Russia, apologizing for buying the country's crude last week.

node.title: Ukrainians measure time by the "number of the day of the war"
node.description: Nadia hasn't been to the seaside in 20 years. The thought of returning is helping her get through what feels like a "millennia" of war in Kharkiv.

node.title: Huge invasive spiders from Asia could spread to much of East Coast
node.description: Millions of the spiders spun three-dimensional golden webs in Georgia in 2021 and a new study says they could spread "throughout most of the Eastern seaboard."

node.title: Iran says it's put a second military satellite into orbit
node.description: Launch comes with talks on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal between Tehran and major powers in a critical stage.

node.title: South Korea says it fired on North Korean patrol boat
node.description: It happened in waters both countries claim. Seoul says the North Korean vessel was chasing an unarmed one from the North, which the South seized.

node.title: Covid-19: 23,894 new cases today, 756 people in hospital - Ministry of Health
node.description: The Ministry of Health is reporting 23,894 new cases of Covid-19, with 9881 in Auckland.

node.title: Police name man who died in Taupō motel
node.description: The man whose death is being investigated after he died at a motel in Taupō last Sunday has been named.

node.title: US warns against travel to New Zealand due to rising Covid-19 cases
node.description: The United States' Centre for Disease Control and Prevention has today raised its travel advisory warning on travel to New Zealand.

node.title: Hamiltonians want community boards, but who will pay?
node.description: A local community trust has called on Hamilton City Council and the Local Government Commission to implement community boards into the most marginalised suburbs.

node.title: Lawyer defends Mainzeal directors' reliance on parent company's funding
node.description: The lawyer for three former directors of Mainzeal says it was reasonable for them to rely on assurances the firm would get financial support from its parent company.

node.title: Sanctions will act as 'wall of resistance' and send message to Russia - Mahuta
node.description: Officials are taking a progressive approach to identifying oligarchs and others helping the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the foreign minister says. Audio

node.title: White Ferns bounce back with big World Cup win
node.description: The White Ferns have a win on the board in the Cricket World Cup.

node.title: Government fast-tracks visa support for Ukrainians
node.description: The government is extending the temporary visas of more than 100 Ukrainian nationals in response to the Russian invasion.

node.title: Abuse of Middlemore staff worsening, union says
node.description: A Middlemore Hospital worker and the nurses union say verbal abuse against health staff is worsening under Covid-19 visitor restrictions.

node.title: Ukraine decries 'immoral' stunt after Moscow says it will let civilians flee - to Russia
node.description: Russia has announced new "humanitarian corridors" to transport Ukrainians trapped under its bombardment - to Russia itself and its ally Belarus.

node.title: KGH hires bank to test market for Kiwi Wealth sale
node.description: State-owned financial services firm Kiwi Group Holdings has confirmed it has hired an investment bank to test the market for its fund management company Kiwi Wealth.

node.title: Pentagon says Guantanamo detainee linked to 9/11 transferred to Saudi Arabia
node.description: Mohammad Mani Ahmad al-Qahtani has been accused of being the "20th hijacker" in the 9/11 plot, but his lawyers say he suffers from schizophrenia.

node.title: Shane Warne died of natural causes
node.description: An autopsy showed the death last week of Australian cricket great Shane Warne on Koh Samui in Thailand was due to natural causes.

node.title: New Zealand could experience 'two peaks' in Covid-19 hospitalisations - Plank
node.description: Much of New Zealand is one or two weeks behind Auckland's Covid-19 curve, and the country might experience two peaks of hospitalisations, a data modeller says. Audio

node.title: Cranmer Square protesters told to leave by Thursday
node.description: Protesters illegally camped at Christchurch's Cranmer Square for nearly four weeks have been asked to leave by Thursday.

node.title: Increasing number of MPs isolating or infected with Covid-19
node.description: A third of National's MPs are confirmed to be in isolation, along with six Labour MPs and Rawiri Waititi from Te Pāti Māori.

node.title: Ukraine will continue to fight and suffer alone, for one simple reason
node.description: Analysis: The Ukraine war proves ownership of nuclear weapons with the capacity to destroy entire cities, if not countries, really is a protection against meaningful opposition, Philip Williams…

node.title: Gender inequality: Call for pay gap reporting for all employers
node.description: A range of reports on International Women's Day shows women continue to be disadvantaged and suffer from workplace imbalance and the gender pay gap.

node.title: Housing crisis: Homeless mother of seven forced to pitch a tent during storm
node.description: A homeless mother of six young children and a newborn baby says she had no option but to pitch a tent in a Hawke's Bay park during a storm after Work and Income refused to help her.

node.title: Ukrainian refugees add to millions displaced around the world
node.description: Russia's invasion has spawned the biggest movement of people in Europe in decades. They're just the latest of millions of others who have been displaced by conflict, violence or insecurity.

node.title: U.S. "actively" working with Poland on deal to send fighter jets to Ukraine
node.description: The Biden administration is in discussions on how to backfill planes for European allies who send jets to Ukraine.
